topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553478fb6368726d56db0000#post_553478fb6368726d56db0000
[bq="QuasarNova"]For Linux users, is Gentoo as much a nightmare as they say?
[/bq]
Don't touch gentoo if you're a new user.

The most user friendly linux distro would be ubuntu.

Honestly as a long time linux user linux used to suck, but now it doesn't.  A lot of games now work on ubuntu and for those that don't work you can install playonlinux for making it simple to understand how to install windows games on linux; not every game works but a fair bit works now.  Playonlinux uses Wine and if you want to know if you can play a game on linux just look up the game on WineHQ (the website).
